title: licoread
code: library(licoread) # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path <- system.file("extdata/82z", package = "licoread") # provide the location of your raw files to licoread data <- licoread(path)  # if your location containes more than one file type, you will have to specify # which files licoread should read path <- system.file("extdata/mixed_files", package = "licoread") gas_df_82z <- licoread(path, file_type = "82z")

title: licoread
text: 82z file type, name measured gases intuitive. can use list_gases() function list gases present dataset.
code: path_81x <- system.file("extdata/81x", package = "licoread") gas_df_81x <- licoread(path_81x)  co2_df <- licoread_to_fluxible(   gas_df_81x,   "CO2",   datetime_col = "Date" ) #> File type is 81x. #> Unnesting the data... #> Formatting datetime column... #> Looking for start and end of each measurement... list_gases(gas_df_82z) #> File type is 82z. #> [1] "LI-7810_CH4_DRY" "LI-7810_CO2_DRY" "LI-7820_N2O_DRY" "LI-7825_CO2"  ch4_dry <- licoread_to_fluxible(   gas_df_82z,   "LI-7810_CH4_DRY",   datetime_col = c("LI-8250_DATE", "LI-8250_TIME") ) #> File type is 82z. #> Unnesting the data... #> Selecting the focus gas... #> Formatting datetime column... #> Looking for start and end of each measurement...

what: Importing data from LI7500 tent setup
title: licoread
text: function licoread::import7500 tailored import data files LI7500 tent setup described Halbritter et al. (2024). plotinfo argument imports information contained filename separated underscore, example [location]_[date]_[time day]_[trial].txt. function recursive read files designated folder subfolders. therefore necessary designated folder contains files import recorded setup. default settings import files update LI7500. read files created update LI7500, set version = "post2023". case comment written creating files (typically inserted line column names), automatically added column comment.
code: # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path_co2fluxtent <- system.file("extdata/co2fluxtent", package = "licoread") data <- import7500(   path_co2fluxtent,   plotinfo = c("date", "location", "time_of_day", "trial") ) # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path_pftc7 <- system.file("extdata/pftc7", package = "licoread") data <- import7500(path_pftc7, version = "post2023") # this step is not needed if you know where your data are path_pftc5 <- system.file("extdata/pftc5", package = "licoread") data <- import7500(   path_pftc5,   plotinfo = c("site", "block", "date", "plot", "trial") )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Gaudard. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gaudard J (2025). licoread: Reads Raw Files Li-COR Gas Analyzers. R package version 0.3.0, https://jogaudard.github.io/licoread/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {licoread: Reads Raw Files from Li-COR Gas Analyzers},   author = {Joseph Gaudard},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://jogaudard.github.io/licoread/}, }

what: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
title: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
text: imports data li7500 setup described Halbritter et al (2024)

title: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
text: path location files. Note function recursive import files location version "till2023" (default) refers setup li7500 update. update version, use "post2023". plotinfo character vector names use separating plot info file name. Names file name separated underscore, ex: [location]_[date]_[time day]_[trial].txt. FALSE (default) means information fetched filename.

title: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
text: dataframe data present files import. New datetime fluxid columns contain respectively datetime measurements original filename. comments present, column contain comments. Measurement informations file names stored new columns according plotinfo.

title: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
text: Halbritter, .H., Vandvik, V., Cotner, S.H. et al. Plant trait vegetation data along 1314 m elevation gradient fire history Puna grasslands, Perú. Sci Data 11, 225 (2024). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-024-02980-3

title: imports data from li7500 setup — import7500
code: path_pftc7 <- system.file("extdata/pftc7", package = "licoread") import7500(path_pftc7, version = "post2023") #> # A tibble: 330 × 42 #>    f_fluxid            DATAH Time  Date       `Sequence Number` `CO2 (mmol/m^3)` #>    <chr>               <chr> <chr> <date>                 <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            123540             13.6 #>  2 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            123840             13.3 #>  3 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            124140             13.2 #>  4 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            124440             13.7 #>  5 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            124740             13.4 #>  6 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            125040             13.1 #>  7 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            125340             13.4 #>  8 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            125640             13.3 #>  9 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            125940             13.2 #> 10 1_2000_east_1_day_… DATA  10:5… 2023-12-14            126240             13.3 #> # ℹ 320 more rows #> # ℹ 36 more variables: `CO2 (mg/m^3)` <dbl>, `CO2 Absorptance` <dbl>, #> #   `CO2 (umol/mol)` <dbl>, `H2O (mmol/m^3)` <dbl>, `H2O (g/m^3)` <dbl>, #> #   `H2O Absorptance` <dbl>, `H2O (mmol/mol)` <dbl>, `Dew Point (C)` <dbl>, #> #   `Temperature (C)` <dbl>, `Pressure (kPa)` <dbl>, `Diagnostic Value` <dbl>, #> #   `Diagnostic Value 2` <dbl>, `Diagnostic Word` <dbl>, `DSI Vin (v)` <dbl>, #> #   `Cooler Voltage (v)` <dbl>, `Chopper Cooler Voltage (v)` <dbl>, …  path_pftc5 <- system.file("extdata/pftc5", package = "licoread") import7500(path_pftc5, plotinfo = c("site", "treatment", "date", "plot", "trial")) #> # A tibble: 251 × 25 #>    f_fluxid   `Relative Time` Temperature Pressure `Aux Input` `CO2 Absorptance` #>    <chr>                <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>             <dbl> #>  1 ACJ_B_15m…            0.88        20.9     67.9           0            0.0638 #>  2 ACJ_B_15m…            1.94        20.9     67.9           0            0.0637 #>  3 ACJ_B_15m…            2.88        20.9     67.9           0            0.0633 #>  4 ACJ_B_15m…            3.94        20.9     67.9           0            0.063  #>  5 ACJ_B_15m…            4.86        20.9     67.9           0            0.063  #>  6 ACJ_B_15m…            5.88        20.9     67.9           0            0.063  #>  7 ACJ_B_15m…            6.86        20.9     67.9           0            0.0632 #>  8 ACJ_B_15m…            7.88        20.9     67.9           0            0.0625 #>  9 ACJ_B_15m…            8.86        20.9     67.9           0            0.063  #> 10 ACJ_B_15m…            9.88        20.9     67.9           0            0.063  #> # ℹ 241 more rows #> # ℹ 19 more variables: `CO2 mmol/m3` <dbl>, `CO2 mg/m3` <dbl>, #> #   `CO2 umol/mol` <dbl>, `H2O Absorptance` <dbl>, `H2O mmol/m3` <dbl>, #> #   `H2O g/m3` <dbl>, `H2O mmol/mol` <dbl>, `H2O(°C)` <dbl>, #> #   `Cooler Voltage` <dbl>, f_datetime <dttm>, comment <chr>, f_start <dttm>, #> #   f_end <dttm>, pressure_atm <dbl>, site <chr>, treatment <chr>, date <chr>, #> #   plot <chr>, trial <chr>  path_co2fluxtent <- system.file("extdata/co2fluxtent", package = "licoread") import7500(path_co2fluxtent, plotinfo = c("date", "location", "time_of_day", "trial")) #> # A tibble: 345 × 24 #>    f_fluxid   `Relative Time` Temperature Pressure `Aux Input` `CO2 Absorptance` #>    <chr>                <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>             <dbl> #>  1 06172020_…            0.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0752 #>  2 06172020_…            1.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0731 #>  3 06172020_…            2.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0737 #>  4 06172020_…            3.98       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0731 #>  5 06172020_…            4.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.073  #>  6 06172020_…            5.92       -66.2     75.7           0            0.0729 #>  7 06172020_…            6.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0733 #>  8 06172020_…            7.92       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0733 #>  9 06172020_…            8.91       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0729 #> 10 06172020_…            9.92       -65.7     75.7           0            0.0728 #> # ℹ 335 more rows #> # ℹ 18 more variables: `CO2 mmol/m3` <dbl>, `CO2 mg/m3` <dbl>, #> #   `CO2 umol/mol` <dbl>, `H2O Absorptance` <dbl>, `H2O mmol/m3` <dbl>, #> #   `H2O g/m3` <dbl>, `H2O mmol/mol` <dbl>, `H2O(°C)` <dbl>, #> # what: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
title: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
text: reads Li-COR files given location

title: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
code: licoread(   location,   file_type = "auto",   file_type_list = c("82z", "81x", "auto"),   data_file = "data.csv",   meta_file = "metadata.json",   regex_file = "(\\w*-)*\\w*(?=([.]82z$))",   sample = FALSE )

title: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
text: location location files file_type type file (82z 81x). "auto" (default), function try detect . file_type_list list file types data_file name file raw data meta_file name file meta data regex_file regex expression matching name 82z file. case user different default easier updates. sample sample = n randomly selects n files imported. allows testing setup importing potentially large list files take time difficult handle.

title: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
text: tibble (nested depending raw data) containing data raw files present location provided

title: reads Li-COR files in a given location — licoread
code: path_82z <- system.file("extdata/82z", package = "licoread") licoread(path_82z) #> # A tibble: 2 × 38 #>   f_fluxid          data     units    `CHAMBER_AREA_cm+2` CHAMBER_COLLAR_HEIGH…¹ #>   <chr>             <list>   <list>                 <dbl>                  <dbl> #> 1 82m-0109-2024072… <tibble> <tibble>                318.                      5 #> 2 82m-0109-2024072… <tibble> <tibble>                318.                      5 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​CHAMBER_COLLAR_HEIGHT_cm #> # ℹ 33 more variables: CHAMBER_LATITUDE_degrees <dbl>, #> #   CHAMBER_LONGITUDE_degrees <dbl>, CHAMBER_PARK_POSITION_degrees <dbl>, #> #   CHAMBER_TUBE_LENGTH_cm <dbl>, `CHAMBER_VOLUME_cm+3` <dbl>, #> #   `LI-7810_TUBE_LENGTH_cm` <dbl>, `LI-7810_VOLUME_cm+3` <dbl>, #> #   `LI-7820_TUBE_LENGTH_cm` <dbl>, `LI-7820_VOLUME_cm+3` <dbl>, #> #   `LI-7825_TUBE_LENGTH_cm` <dbl>, `LI-7825_VOLUME_cm+3` <dbl>, …

title: licoread 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-08-18 import7500: imports files LI7500 setup

title: licoread 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-05-08 list_gases: function list gases dataset

title: licoread 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-04-28 issue leading zeros time columns fixed datetime_col: arguments documentation wrong order. c("date", "time") licoread: option glimpse = n randomly select n files target folder. allows testing without importing long list files (takes time).

title: licoread 0.1.0
text: licoread_to_fluxible: creates df easy use fluxible R package.

title: licoread 0.0.2
text: licoread: function read Li-COR raw files 82z 81x format given location return tibble without losing data units. functions read_82z read_81x removed got integrated licoread

title: licoread 0.0.1
text: read_82z: function read several .82z files given location (including location subfolders). read_81x: function read several observation one .81x file.
